data.name: Battering Ram
data.description:
Durable infantry transport effective against buildings and walls.
+ High ranged armor
+ High health
- Takes bonus damage from melee attacks
- Can only attack buildings
- Slow movement speed

variations.name: Battering Ram
variations.description:
Durable infantry transport effective against buildings and walls.
+ High ranged armor
+ High health
- Takes bonus damage from melee attacks
- Can only attack buildings
- Slow movement speed

data.name: Carrack
data.description:
Large sailed war vessel armed with broadside cannons.
+ Anti-structure specialist
- Low movement speed

variations.name: Carrack
variations.description:
Large sailed war vessel armed with broadside cannons.
+ Anti-structure specialist

data.name: Counterweight Trebuchet
data.description:
Powerful siege engine effective at destroying buildings and walls over a great distance.
+ Bonus damage vs buildings
- Must be set up to fire
- Inaccurate against units

variations.name: Counterweight Trebuchet
variations.description:
Powerful siege engine effective at destroying buildings and walls over a great distance.
+ Bonus damage vs buildings
- Must be set up to fire
- Inaccurate against units

data.name: Culverin
data.description:
Long-range mobile cannon with bonus vs buildings.
+ Effective against Defenses
+ Does not require setup to fire

variations.name: Culverin
variations.description:
Long-range mobile cannon with bonus vs buildings.
+ Effective against Defenses
+ Does not require setup to fire

data.name: Demolition Ship
data.description:
Small ship packed with explosives. Detonates when killed, damaging any units in the area.
- Damage is reduced further from the explosion center
- No weapons other than self-destruction

variations.name: Demolition Ship
variations.description:
Small ship packed with explosives. Detonates when killed, damaging any units in the area.
- Damage is reduced further from the explosion center
- No weapons other than self-destruction

data.name: Fishing Boat
data.description:
Small boat that gathers Food from either Deep Water Fish or Shoreline Fish. Drops off gathered resources at the Dock.
+ Can repair
- No combat

variations.name: Fishing Boat
variations.description:
Small boat that gathers Food from either Deep Water Fish or Shoreline Fish. Drops off gathered resources at the Dock.
+ Can repair
- No combat

data.name: Galley
data.description:
Oared war vessel armed with a crew of archers.
+ Increased maneuverability
+ Benefits from ranged damage Blacksmith technology

variations.description:

data.name: Gilded Archer
data.description:
Cheap ranged infantry with good damage vs. unarmored targets.
+ High rate of fire
- Weak against high ranged armor targets
- Countered by Horsemen

gilded-archer-2.name: Gilded Archer
gilded-archer-2.description:
Ranged infantry with good damage vs. unarmored targets and increased fire rate and longer weapon range than standard Archers.
+ Increased weapon range
+ Faster attack speed
- Weak against armored targets
- Countered by Horsemen

data.name: Gilded Crossbowman
data.description:
Crossbowmen with increased range and exceptionally high damage against heavy units.
+ Anti-heavy specialist
+ Long range
- Low health
- Countered by Horsemen

data.name: Gilded Handcannoneer
data.description:
More powerful all-purpose ranged infantry with increased attack speed.
+ High damage
+ Increased attack speed
- High cost
- Slow movement speed
- Countered by Horsemen

variations.name: Gilded Handcannoneer
variations.description:
More powerful all-purpose ranged infantry with increased attack speed.
+ High damage
+ Increased attack speed
- High cost
- Slow movement speed
- Countered by Horsemen

data.name: Gilded Horseman
data.description:
Fast cavalry effective at raiding, flanking, and countering ranged units.
+ High movement speed
- Weak against melee units
- Countered by Spearmen

data.name: Gilded Knight
data.description:
Expensive cavalry with a powerful charge.
+ Heavy armor
+ Strong in melee combat
- Countered by Spearmen and Crossbowmen

gilded-knight-4.name: Elite Gilded Knight
gilded-knight-4.description:
Expensive cavalry with high damage and melee armor. Effective against melee units.
+ Heavy armor
+ Strong in melee combat
- Countered by Spearmen and Crossbowmen

data.name: Gilded Landsknecht
data.description:
Brave unarmored infantry with an enormous two-handed sword, effective in mixed armies.
+ Melee attack deals area damage
- Low health
- Countered by Archers

data.name: Gilded Man-at-Arms
data.description:
Tough infantry with good damage.
+ High armor
- Slow movement
- Countered by Knights, Lancers, and Crossbowmen

data.name: Gilded Spearman
data.description:
Infantry best used against mounted units.
+ Anti-cavalry specialist
+ Additional damage against Elephants
- Weak against heavy infantry
- Countered by Archers

data.name: Gilded Villager
data.description:
Gathers Wood, Food, Stone, and Gold. Builds and repairs buildings and can repair siege engines and naval units. Gathers resources 28% quicker and builds and repairs 20% faster than regular Villagers.
- Weak in combat

variations.description:

+ Effective against massed units
- Must be set up to fire

data.name: Prelate
data.description:
Support unit with no combat capability. Can pick up Relics, convert enemy units, and capture Sacred Sites starting in the Castle Age (III).
+ Heals friendly units
- Low health

data.name: Scout
data.description:
Lightly armed cavalry effective at exploring the world, hunting wildlife, and herding Sheep.
+ Able to see into Stealth Forests
+ Health regeneration
+ High movement speed
- Very weak in combat

data.name: Siege Tower
data.description:
Tall infantry transport with no combat capability. Allows garrisoned infantry to be unloaded directly onto Stone Walls.
+ High ranged armor
- Cannot attack
- Slow movement speed

data.name: Springald
data.description:
Anti-unit siege weapon. Fires bolts that pierce multiple units.
+ Does not require setup to fire
+ Bonus damage vs. melee infantry
- Trivial damage vs. buildings

data.name: Trade Ship
data.description:
Trade Ships generate Gold and Wood when assigned to a trade route with a Coastal Trade Post or another player's Dock.
- No combat

variations.name: Trade Ship
variations.description:
Trade Ships generate Gold and Wood when assigned to a trade route with a Coastal Trade Post or another player's Dock.
- No combat

data.name: Trader
data.description:
Traders generate Gold by travelling between their Home Market and a Trade Post or another player's Market. Greater distances between the Home Market and trade destination will generate higher amounts of Gold.
The Home Market or Trade destination may be changed at any time.

variations.name: Trader
variations.description:
Traders generate Gold by travelling between their Home Market and a Trade Post or another player's Market. Greater distances between the Home Market and trade destination will generate higher amounts of Gold.
The Home Market or Trade destination may be changed at any time.

data.name: Transport Ship
data.description:
Large oared vessel able to transport land units across water.
+ Can be garrisoned by any unit
+ Uses sight range of units in garrison
- No combat

variations.description:

+ Can be garrisoned by any unit
